add.value:
1|XSplit has detected that a modified system file "DSound.dll" has been placed in "{0}" directory. The file description is "{1}". This modification will cause XSplit to crash or become unstable.
Allow XSplit to fix this problem by renaming "{0}\DSound.dll"? (This will only affect the program that placed the file there and not Flash)|%windir%\system32\Macromed\Flash\DSound.dll

1|XSplit has detected BitDefender module hook which has been known to cause crash/freeze in XSplit.
It is advised to add the XSplit application to BitDefender exclusion or disable BitDefender before continuing to run XSplit. For further guidance refer to [this](https://xspl.it/awvs51) blog post.
Continue anyway?|a[tv]cuf32.dll|a[tv]cuf64.dll:re

1|BlackMagic Design MJPEG decoder was detected which is known to cause issue with certain capture cards and video files in XSplit.
Allow XSplit to fix this problem by deleting registry value below:
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Drivers32 vidc.mjpg|HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Drivers32|vidc.mjpg|BMDCodecMJPG64.dll

1|1|1|<config><item name="Vender.dll" minversion="1.1.0.8" /><item name="GPUTweak.exe" minversion="2.8.0.8" /><item name="GPUTweakII.exe" minversion="1.0.0.95" /><gpuitem pnpdevidre="^PCI\\VEN_1002.*" minversion="0.0.0.0" /><gpuitem pnpdevidre="^PCI\\VEN_10DE.*" minversion="0.0.0.0" /><gpuitem2 pnpdevidre="SUBSYS.*1043" /><smbios manufacturerre="asustek" /></config>

1|XSplit has detected that a modified system file "DSound.dll" has been placed in "{0}" directory. The file description is "{1}". This modification will cause XSplit to crash or become unstable.
Allow XSplit to fix this problem by renaming "{0}\DSound.dll"? (This will only affect the program that placed the file there and not Flash)|%windir%\system32\Macromed\Flash\DSound.dll

1|XSplit has detected BitDefender module hook which has been known to cause crash/freeze in XSplit.
It is advised to add the XSplit application to BitDefender exclusion or disable BitDefender before continuing to run XSplit. For further guidance refer to [this](https://xspl.it/awvs51) blog post.
Continue anyway?|a[tv]cuf32.dll:re
